A while ago, a website talked about the dangers of public check-ins. Public check-ins are when you tell people online where you are. The website said that when you say, "Hey, I’m at this place," you are also telling many people where you are, including some you might not want to meet. This shows that sharing everything online can have bad sides. 
The internet gives us many chances to share our lives with a lot of people. We can share our stories, photos, and feelings. But sometimes, we can get lost in this sharing. It can feel overwhelming. However, there is hope. A long time ago, some people, called online pioneers, explored the internet and learned about its dangers. They faced many problems, like losing jobs and friends, before social media was created. These pioneers, who we now call bloggers, have important stories to tell us.
In January 1994, Justin Hall, a 19-year-old student, started sharing his life online. At that time, the web was mostly used by students and scientists. Hall wanted to share his experiences. He created a blog where he wrote about everything in his life. In January 1996, he began posting every day, and many people started to read his blog. Hall was open about his life, and he wrote about any topic. Some people thought this was just showing off, but others saw it as art.
One day, visitors to Hall’s blog found that his homepage was gone. Instead, there was a video called Dark Night. In the video, Hall explained that he had fallen in love, but when he wrote about it, he was told to choose between his blog and his relationship. He felt that sharing his life online made people not trust him. The blog ended, but the problem of sharing online still exists. Sharing online can be fun, but if you think it will make people want to be with you, you might be disappointed.
In 2002, Heather Armstrong, a young woman in Los Angeles, had a blog called Dooce. She sometimes wrote about her job. One day, a coworker sent her blog link to the bosses at her company, including some she had made fun of. Because of this, she lost her job. People who study online behavior call this the "online distribution effect." This means that many of us feel we can say things online that we would never say in person. But the internet is not a place where we can say anything without consequences. Our online lives are connected to our real lives. If we forget this, we can make big mistakes.
Armstrong’s story had a happy ending. Even though she was sad and stopped blogging for a while, she got married and started a new blog about her family. Now, she is popular among "mommy bloggers," and her writing helps support her family. She learned an important lesson: the internet lets us say anything, but that doesn’t mean we should.

'Some scientists started a campaign to warn people about a low-budget film called What the Bleep Do We Know? This film mixes documentary and drama to show that there is a lot about our universe that we do not understand. Scientists can be a bit proud sometimes, but even the most confident physicist would not say they know everything about the universe. However, some scientists felt they needed to warn the public about the film, calling it things like ‘atrocious’ and ‘very dangerous’. This made me curious to see the movie. 
At first, I did not understand why the film was so important. Some scientists talked about new discoveries that show the universe is stranger than we thought. But when the film talked about these discoveries, I began to see why it was interesting. One claim was that water molecules can be changed by thoughts. I had heard before that a Japanese researcher showed that the shape of a water molecule could change based on the feelings of people around it. The movie showed pictures of ice crystals that looked beautiful after being talked to by happy people, and ugly after being around people in a bad mood. Many people find this kind of evidence convincing. It is simple and makes them smile. But scientists usually say, ‘Give me a break’. 
I understand their point. The idea that water can be affected by thoughts is amazing, but we need good proof that it is true. Pretty pictures of crystals are not enough. The real issue is that the movie’s claims were not strange enough. For example, water molecules might have properties from a kind of energy that comes from nowhere, which is linked to a force that is making the universe expand. The evidence for this comes from many years of research in labs and observatories around the world. 
Scientists are making discoveries that show the universe is stranger than we thought. Astronomers have found that the universe is made of an unknown kind of matter and is pushed by a mysterious force called ‘dark energy’. Other discoveries are also surprising. Neuroscientists found that our awareness of events happens half a second after they occur. This delay is not noticed because our brains edit it out. Anthropologists believe they have found where modern humans began and how they spread across the world. Some theorists even think there are links between life on Earth and the design of the universe. 
Despite what some people think, science is not finished. In fact, we seem to know less than before. Many natural events cannot be understood as we once thought. The ideas of chaos and quantum uncertainty show that there are limits to what we can know. Some of the best theoretical physicists are trying to create a Theory of Everything, which would explain all the forces and particles in the universe with one equation. But many of us believe the universe is best described in one word: incredible.'

"Writing novels is a challenge for me, but writing short stories is a joy. If writing a novel is like planting a big forest, then writing a short story is like planting a small garden. Both are important to me. The trees in the forest give shade, and the wind moves the leaves, which can turn bright gold. In the garden, flowers bloom, and their colorful petals attract bees and butterflies. This shows the change of seasons.
Since I started writing, I have often switched between novels and short stories. After I finish a novel, I want to write short stories. After I finish a group of short stories, I want to write a novel. I never write short stories while I am writing a novel, and I never write a novel while I am working on short stories. Writing these two types of stories uses different parts of my brain, and it takes time to change from one to the other.
I began my career with two short novels in 1975. From 1984 to 1985, I started writing short stories. I did not know much about writing short stories then, so it was hard, but it was a memorable experience. I felt my imagination grow, and readers liked this new side of me. One of my first short stories, ‘Breaking Waves’, was in my first collection called Tales from Abroad. This was my start as a short-story writer.
One of the best things about writing short stories is that they do not take long to finish. Usually, it takes me about a week to write a short story, but I can spend a lot of time revising it. Writing a novel takes a year or two, and it can feel very long. Sometimes I wonder if I will finish. So, writing short stories is a nice change for me.
Another good thing about short stories is that you can create them from small ideas – a thought, a word, or an image. It feels like jazz music, where the story goes where it wants. You also do not have to worry about failing. If an idea does not work, you can just move on and remember that not every story can be perfect. Even great writers like F. Scott Fitzgerald and Raymond Carver have stories that are not perfect. This makes me feel better. I can learn from my mistakes and use that knowledge in my next story.
When I write novels, I try to learn from what works and what does not in my short stories. In this way, short stories are like a practice space for me as a novelist. It is hard to try new things in a novel, so without short stories, writing novels would be even harder for me. My short stories are like soft shadows I have left in the world. I remember where I wrote each one and how I felt. Short stories are like signs to my heart, and I am happy to share these feelings with my readers."

Science is a way to understand the world. It helps us in many ways, like curing diseases, but it can also create problems. Science tries to explain everything, from tiny atoms to the universe. It has influenced many people, including poets and politicians. Sometimes, people do not understand science well, and its importance can be seen in different ways. 
Science is always changing. New ideas can replace old ones, and this can cause arguments among scientists. For example, in the past, people thought the universe was like a big clock. Now, scientists have new ideas that change how we see the universe. 
Famous scientists like Isaac Newton and Albert Einstein have helped us understand more about the world. Even though science makes mistakes, it keeps moving forward. In the late 1800s, many scientists thought there was not much left to discover, but then they found new things like radioactivity and the electron.
Today, some people believe we will soon have a complete theory that explains everything about the universe. Science is important because it affects our lives. We are not just watching nature; we are changing it. This means we need to pay attention to science and understand its effects on our future and the world our children will live in.

Since about 2015, many big book publishers have said that sales of ebooks have stopped growing or have even gone down. This has made people question if ebooks will be important in the future. One publishing executive said that the excitement about ebooks may have led to bad investments, and his company lost faith in the value of printed books. Even though it seems that ebooks and printed books can exist together, people still ask if ebooks will replace printed books. This question is interesting and causes a lot of discussion. 
Why do we think about ebooks and printed books as if they are in a fight? The answers to this question tell us more about how we feel about new technology and change. In my research, I found that people often think one type of media will replace another when new technology comes out. For example, when television was invented, many people thought radio would disappear. But radio found new ways to be used, like in cars and factories. 
The idea that books might disappear is not new. In 1894, some people thought that the phonograph would replace books with audiobooks. This has happened many times with movies, radio, television, and smartphones. Some people worried that if books disappeared, culture would suffer. Others thought ebooks would be much better. 
The idea that books might die often comes up when new technology appears. This shows our mixed feelings about change. We form strong connections with different types of media, like books and computers. Many studies show that we can feel very attached to things, even naming our cars or getting upset when our laptops don’t work. 
When new technology, like e-readers, comes out, it changes our relationship with things we love. As technology changes, we often miss what we used to have. This is why some people still want older products. For example, when the printing press was invented in the 15th century, people wanted original manuscripts. When movies changed from silent to sound in the 1920s, people felt nostalgic for silent films. The same thing happened when photography changed from film to digital and from vinyl records to CDs. 
E-readers have made people appreciate the physical qualities of printed books, even their smell. This should make those who worry about printed books feel better. However, the idea that books might disappear will continue to be a popular story about technology and our fear of change. One way we deal with change is by using familiar stories, like those about loss and endings. The story of the death of the book reflects both our excitement for the future and our fear of losing things we love, including parts of ourselves. 
**Questions:**
1. What have many big book publishers said about ebook sales since 2015?
2. What did one publishing executive say about the excitement for ebooks?
3. Why do people think ebooks and printed books are in a fight?
4. What happened to radio when television was invented?
5. What did some people think would happen to books when the phonograph was invented?
6. How do people feel about new technology and change, according to the text?
7. What do e-readers make people appreciate about printed books?

Every weekday morning for a year and a half, I woke up at 5:30, brushed my teeth, made coffee, and wrote about how some great thinkers from the last four hundred years did their best work. I wanted to show how they organized their time to be creative and productive. By writing about their daily lives – when they slept, ate, worked, and worried – I hoped to give a new view of their personalities and careers. 
The French writer Jean Anthelme Brillat-Savarin once said, “Tell me what you eat, and I shall tell you what you are.” I say, “Tell me what time you eat, and if you take a nap afterward.” This book is about the daily lives of creative people, not just their work. It is also personal. The writer John Cheever believed that you show something about yourself in everything you write. 
I have questions that I think about in my own life: How can you do creative work while also making money? Is it better to focus on one project or to work a little each day? When there is not enough time, do you have to give things up, like sleep or a clean house? Or can you learn to do more in less time? I do not have all the answers, but I want to show how many successful people faced similar challenges. 
The title of the book is Daily Rituals, but I really focus on people’s routines. A routine can seem boring, but it can also help you use your time and energy better. The psychologist William James said that having good habits can help us focus on important things. Ironically, he was a procrastinator and could not keep a regular schedule. 
This book started because of my own procrastination. One Sunday afternoon, I was at my job at a small architecture magazine, trying to write a story that was due the next day. Instead of working, I was cleaning my desk and making coffee. I am a “morning person” and can focus well in the morning, but I struggle in the afternoon. To feel better about this, I started looking online for information about other writers’ schedules. I thought it would be good to collect these stories, so I started the Daily Routines blog that day, and now this book. 
The blog was simple; I shared people’s routines from biographies and articles. For the book, I have gathered more information and tried to keep it interesting. I let my subjects speak for themselves through quotes from their letters and diaries. In some cases, I summarized their routines from other sources. I want to thank the many biographers and journalists whose work helped me. I have listed all my sources in the Notes section for further reading.

Howard wanted to be a palaeontologist since he was six years old. When he was a child, his father said they could not go on holiday to Spain because of money problems. Instead, they went to a beach in England. One day, Howard found an ammonite shell on the beach. He loved studying old creatures and decided he wanted to learn more about the past.
After finishing university, Howard was worried about finding a job. He felt he was good at his work, but he knew that sometimes good people do not get jobs. When a job opened at Tavistock College in London, he applied, but he did not expect to get it.
On the day of his interview, the professor who was supposed to help him had a fight with his wife. He was upset and had an accident, so he could not come to the interview. Another professor, who did not like the first one, took his place. This professor helped Howard get the job, even though Howard did not know him well. Howard was happy to have the job, even if it was not for the reasons he hoped.
Howard enjoyed his work because he could plan and do his research. But sometimes, things in his personal life were chaotic. One day, someone stole his briefcase with his lecture notes at a train station. Angry, Howard went back to the college, called to postpone his lecture, and reported the theft. 
While he was having coffee, he met a colleague who was with a visitor from the Natural History Museum in Nairobi. Howard learned about a new collection of fossils that needed to be studied. This could be a great opportunity for him. Because of the theft, he changed his plans. He decided not to go to a conference in Stockholm or take students to Scotland. Instead, he would find a way to visit the museum in Nairobi. 
**Questions:**
1. Why did Howard want to be a palaeontologist?
2. What happened to Howard's holiday plans when he was a child?
3. How did Howard feel about finding a job after university?
4. What accident happened to the professor on the day of Howard's interview?
5. What did Howard learn about at the coffee meeting?

'Charles Spence will eat almost anything. “We have ice cream made from bee larvae at home,” says the Professor of Experimental Psychology at Oxford University in the UK. They may look like maggots, but they have a “slightly nutty, floral” taste. Spence and his team are trying to make eating bugs more acceptable. He studies how our senses work together to create the taste of food. This research affects what we eat and drink, from big food companies to the menus of famous restaurants. Spence and his team study many details about how we experience food and drink. For example, who we eat with, how food is arranged, and even the color and weight of plates can change how food tastes. In his book, The Perfect Meal, written with Betina Piqueras-Fiszman, he shares interesting facts about food. Did you know that the person who orders first in a restaurant enjoys their food more? And we eat about 35% more food when we are with one other person, and 75% more when we are with three people? 
Spence’s lab in Oxford is simple. He says it is “low-tech, paper and drawing pin stuff.” There are soundproof booths that look like big safes, and old audio-visual equipment. By keeping costs low, he can work with cooks who do not have money for research. Much of his work is funded by a big food company. In the past, some people thought that research funded by companies was not real science. But now, universities need to show that their work is useful and interesting, so this type of research is important. Spence is helping famous brands reduce salt and sugar in their products. It is good for customers to stay healthy. Many companies have been making these changes quietly, so customers do not notice. “When you tell people what you are doing, they focus on the taste and often do not like it as much,” he says.
Spence met famous chef Heston Blumenthal while working on a project for a big food company. At that time, people thought science and food did not go together, but most food is scientific. Blumenthal wanted to change this idea. Together, they created the “Sound of the Sea” dish in Blumenthal’s restaurant. Spence says that a long time ago, some artists were also trying to connect sounds with food, but it did not become popular. Now, the food industry is using Spence’s research in many ways. For example, higher-pitched music can make food taste sweeter, while lower-pitched sounds can make it taste bitter. An airline will soon match music with the food served to passengers. Last year, a well-known brand made a smartphone app that played music while your ice cream melts, but they did not match the music to the taste.
What are dinner parties like at Spence’s home? One time, they ate rabbit with the fur around the cutlery. Another time, they played with colorful light bulbs. “We’ve had dinner parties with a tone generator, headphones, and 10 different drinks to see if they have different sounds.” Home, sweet shops, food conventions, and international food conferences are all part of Spence’s work.'

Our brains are very busy today. We get a lot of information, like facts, rumors, and opinions, and we have to figure out what is important and what we can ignore. We are also doing more things than before. Thirty years ago, travel agents helped us book flights, and salespeople helped us find things in stores. Now, we do most of these things ourselves. We are trying to do the work of many people while also managing our lives, families, jobs, hobbies, and favorite TV shows. Our smartphones help us with all of this. They are part of our busy lives, where we try to do as much as possible in every free moment.
But there is a problem. We think we are multitasking, which means doing many things at once, but this is not true. Earl Miller, a scientist at MIT, says our brains are not good at multitasking. When we think we are multitasking, we are really just switching quickly from one task to another. Each time we switch, it takes more effort. So, we are not like expert jugglers; we are more like people trying to keep many plates spinning, worried that one will fall.
Even though we think we are getting a lot done, multitasking makes us less efficient. It can increase stress hormones in our bodies, which can make us feel confused or foggy. Multitasking can also make our brains crave new things, which distracts us from what we are trying to focus on. The part of our brain that helps us stay on task can easily be distracted by new things.
Just having the chance to multitask can hurt our ability to think clearly. Glenn Wilson, a psychology professor, found that trying to focus on a task while seeing an unread email can lower our IQ by almost 10 points. He showed that multitasking can cause more problems than being tired. Another scientist, Russ Poldrack, found that learning new things while multitasking can send the information to the wrong part of the brain. For example, if students do homework while watching TV, the information does not get stored properly. Without distractions, the information is stored better and is easier to remember.
Multitasking also involves making decisions, like whether to answer a text or ignore it. Making decisions is hard for our brains, and small decisions can use as much brain power as big ones. After making many small decisions, we can end up making bad choices about important things.
Many business leaders and scientists talk about the problem of too much information, especially emails. It is not that emails are bad, but the huge number of them can be overwhelming. When a 10-year-old boy was asked what his father does, he said, "He answers emails." His father agreed that this is true. We feel we must reply to emails, but it is hard to do that and get anything else done.
**Questions:**
1. What do we have to do with the information we receive?
2. How did people book flights thirty years ago?
3. What do smartphones help us with?
4. What does Earl Miller say about multitasking?
5. What can happen to our IQ when we try to focus on a task and see an unread email?
6. What happens to information when students do homework and watch TV at the same time?
7. Why is making decisions hard for our brains?
8. What did the 10-year-old boy say about his father’s job?

In a zoo in Sweden, a chimpanzee named Santino spent his nights breaking concrete into pieces. He threw these pieces at visitors during the day. Was he being mean? In caves in the US, female bats help other fruit bat mothers if they cannot find the right way to give birth. Are they being kind? Fifty years ago, people did not think these questions were important. Animals had behaviors, and science studied these behaviors. The idea that animals have feelings and thoughts was not taken seriously. But now, this is starting to change. Research on bats, chimps, rats, dolphins, and chickens shows that animals have emotions. This new idea is being discussed in popular science books, like Mark Bekoff’s *Wild Justice* and Victoria Braithwaite’s *Do Fish Feel Pain?* 
This change has started a debate: do animals have thoughts and feelings? This leads to another question: do animals have a sense of right and wrong? In a recent experiment with cows, those that opened a locked gate to get food seemed happier than those that had the gate opened for them. If cows enjoy solving problems, what does this mean for how we treat them? The facts are clear, but people have different opinions about them. Dr. Jonathan Balcombe, who wrote *Second Nature*, believes we should stop eating meat. He thinks we are close to a big change in how we think about ethics, like when slavery was ended. Aubrey Manning, a professor at Edinburgh University, believes we should think more about how animals think. He says animals might have a simpler way of thinking than humans. Professor Euan MacPhail thinks we should not put human feelings onto animals. 
These three people may never agree because the main issue is not just scientific or moral, but also philosophical. It is very hard to define what consciousness is. Can we ever know what it is like to be a bat? Balcombe describes an important experiment he did that seems to show that starlings, a type of bird, can feel sad. In a study at Newcastle University, starlings were divided into two groups. One group lived in nice cages with plenty of space and water. The other group lived in small, empty cages. At first, both groups learned to eat tasty worms from one box and avoid bad worms from another. But when only bad worms were offered, only the starlings in nice cages would eat. Balcombe thinks that living in a bad cage made the starlings feel negative about life. 
Balcombe, who works with animal rights groups, has strong opinions. He says, “We look back with disgust at a time of racism. One day, we will feel the same about how we treat animals. We cannot support animal rights while eating meat.” If he were the only one with this opinion, it might be easy to ignore him. But Professor Aubrey Manning shares similar views. Manning has written a textbook called *An Introduction to Animal Behaviour*. He says, “What we are seeing is a swing in ideas. In the early 20th century, some people thought animals thought like us, and then others disagreed. Now, we are starting to think differently again. But this is a complicated topic, and we should listen carefully to different opinions.” 
**Questions:**
1. What did Santino the chimpanzee do at the zoo?
2. How do female bats help other fruit bat mothers?
3. What did Dr. Jonathan Balcombe suggest we should do about eating meat?
4. What was the difference between the two groups of starlings in the experiment?
5. Why is the topic of animal consciousness considered complicated?

Critical thinking is a way to understand better what we read or hear. Adrian West, a research director in the U.K., says that arguing can help us find the truth. Technology helps us store information and manage a lot of data, but it can also change how we think about complex problems. West points out that we see a lot of poor thinking and popular opinions that can confuse us. Even though we have more information, it does not always mean we have more knowledge or make better decisions. 
According to the National Endowment for the Arts, fewer people are reading books, and this is happening faster now. Patricia Greenfield, a psychology professor, believes that focusing more on visual media, like videos, can hurt our critical thinking. She says that people are more interested in quick media and doing many things at once instead of focusing on one thing.
There is still no clear answer about how technology affects critical thinking. Technology has changed how we think, and it can be both good and bad. For example, a computer game can help us think critically or make it harder. Reading online can improve our ability to analyze, but clicking on many links can stop us from thinking deeply.
Greenfield studied many research papers about learning and technology. She found that reading helps us think and use our imagination better than visual media like video games and TV. Reading helps us develop critical thinking and vocabulary. However, she also found that some visual media can help with processing information. Unfortunately, most visual media do not give us time to think or reflect.
Many young people do not reach their full potential because of this. How society views technology affects how we think about critical thinking. There is a debate about video games and thinking skills. James Paul Gee, a professor, says that video games are not always bad for kids. They can be a fun way to learn. Some studies show that playing games can help children become smarter and improve their reasoning skills. Games like Sim City and Civilization teach decision-making and analytical skills in a fun way. These games allow players to explore ideas that they might not be able to in real life.
In today’s digital world, as reading and math scores go down, we need to look closely at technology and understand how it affects our thinking. 
**Questions:**
1. What is critical thinking?
2. Who is Adrian West?
3. What does Patricia Greenfield think about visual media?
4. How can video games help children, according to James Paul Gee?
5. Why is it important to understand how technology affects thinking?

Matthew Crawford is a motorcycle mechanic. He chose this job after he became unhappy with working in an office and for social policy groups. His first book was about the good things about manual work. His latest book talks about how to deal with modern life. He got the idea for this book when he was shopping and saw ads on the credit card machine while he was entering his pin number. Crawford realized that it is hard to avoid these ads that take our attention. What we think about is personal, but we often cannot choose this because of things we do not notice. It is getting harder to think or remember conversations. Because people want to avoid being interrupted, they stop talking to strangers. Crawford says, “We see the world through things that are made for us, like video games and apps.” These things show our desires and take over our time. 
Crawford is not alone in his worries. Many office workers complain about emails but still check them in their free time. Studies show that just seeing a phone can make it hard to focus. There is no proof yet that our attention spans are shorter, but people have worried about this since the telegraph was invented in 1837. It is clear that we are more aware of other things we could be doing. Some think this problem is only about technology, but Crawford believes technology helps us focus too much on ourselves. With so many choices, it is hard to control ourselves, which affects our social lives. We often prefer to text friends instead of talking to them. Crawford argues that by only interacting with screens, we might lose important connections in society.
He gives an example from his gym. There used to be one music player for everyone, which could cause some disagreements. Now, people listen to their own music with earbuds. “The gym used to be a social place, but it has lost that,” he says. Real connections often happen when people have different opinions and work through them together.
Crawford has two ideas to help. First, we need rules about noise and distractions in public places. More importantly, he believes we should practice skills that help us engage with the world better. He mentions cooks, ice-hockey players, and motorbike racers as examples of people who deal with real things. No video can replace the feeling of a hockey puck on ice or the gravel under your tires. These people use their good judgment and manage their space with others.
“When you engage with the world this way, fake experiences seem less important,” he says. This does not mean everyone should become a chef, but it is important to use your judgment. There are many benefits to this, including feeling satisfied with your work. Always fighting distractions can be tiring and make it hard to focus on what is important. Paying attention to one thing can help you pay attention to other things too. 
**Questions:**
1. What job does Matthew Crawford do?
2. Why did he become a motorcycle mechanic?
3. What did Crawford notice while shopping that inspired his latest book?
4. What does Crawford say about talking to strangers?
5. How has the gym changed according to Crawford?
6. What are two ideas Crawford has to help with distractions?

"What do you do for a living?" This is a common question in small talk. We often define ourselves by our jobs. But if you are a philosopher, like me, it can be a bit tricky. Saying you are a philosopher can sound a bit showy. It is okay to say you study or teach philosophy, but saying you are a philosopher can make people think you know something special that others do not. This is not true; philosophers are just like everyone else. 
One reason people think this way is that philosophers often judge what others do and talk about thinking deeply. The Greek philosopher Aristotle believed that a life of thinking was the best kind of life. Many modern philosophers do not agree, but people still connect philosophy with deep thinking. Another Greek philosopher, Socrates, said that "the unexamined life is not worth living." This means that just going along with what everyone else thinks is not very satisfying. 
Thinking about our lives helps us make our own choices. But you do not need to read many books or think all the time to examine your life. It just means looking closely at your daily experiences to see if they are important. You do not have to be a wise person living away from society to do this. In fact, examining life can help guide our experiences, and sharing knowledge is important for a good life.
Another reason people misunderstand philosophers is that academic philosophy has become more separate from everyday life, especially for those who do not study it formally. This is not only the philosophers' fault; universities often focus on expensive journals and evaluations. Because of this, philosophers have little chance to share their ideas with anyone outside their small group of experts. For many people, philosophy can seem far away from real life. 
Some philosophers used to challenge this view, but many have stopped. The university system has created a situation where philosophers are isolated. As philosophy has become more focused on specific debates, it has become harder for those outside the field to understand. In some cases, philosophy has become disconnected from society. 
I sometimes call myself an "ethicist" because I work in ethics, which is the part of philosophy that looks at human actions. Recently, I feel this title does not fully describe my work because ethics is often linked to rules and laws. There is a new way of thinking in ethics that looks at whether certain social practices are fair. The job of an ethicist today is to decide if something is "ethical" or acceptable. These are important questions that I think about often.
A typical discussion might start by asking if downloading movies illegally is wrong (it is) and then move on to questions about responsibility, our views on art, and how consumerism affects us. Philosophy can help people think more about the actions and behaviors that shape their lives. Sometimes we might find out something we already know; other times, we may realize our beliefs are hard to explain. By examining these ideas, we can do something good for everyone.

People who love food, like foodies and chefs, often think that thinking about what and how we eat can make eating more enjoyable. However, in history, discussions about food have often been about other ideas instead. When philosophers talk about eating, they usually mean something else, like learning or knowledge. Sometimes, it seems like they are talking about food, but they are really discussing deeper ideas that are not directly about food.
One famous philosopher, Epicurus, believed in seeking pleasure and avoiding pain in many areas of life. His name is now often connected with enjoying food and drink. You can see his name in restaurants and food shops because they think it will attract customers. Food is also social and cultural. The food we eat comes from history and is shared with people in our communities. These communities help us grow and share food. We interact with food more than with any other product, which makes it an interesting topic to think about.
When food is ready, critics start to talk and write about it. But why do they have such a special role? One philosopher said that tasting food is not a special skill; food critics are just better at describing how food tastes. Most discussions about how we perceive things focus on sight, but taste has not been studied much. 
Another important part of food is its beauty. We often say paintings or music are beautiful, but we don’t usually say that about food. Some philosophers believe that, because of modern cooking, food should also be considered beautiful like art. However, food is eaten and gone, while art can last a long time. This makes it hard to say that food is truly beautiful.
There are also many ethical questions about food. We can ask what we should eat: organic, free-range, local, vegetarian, or non-GMO foods? Our answers often show our beliefs about what is right or wrong. Philosophers like to discuss these questions about food.
Cooking at home is different from cooking in restaurants. Home cooks have a special responsibility to their friends and family. In a home kitchen, everyone shares food and time together. But restaurant cooks have to follow rules for their job and their food. Their kitchens are not open to everyone, and their relationships are more like colleagues than friends.
A recent essay called "Diplomacy of the Dish" looks at how food can help connect different cultures. We can learn to appreciate other cultures by enjoying their food. Also, when we eat together, we build friendships with people from other cultures. This idea has been important in international relations for a long time. The essay includes many interesting examples and stories that make food philosophy come alive for readers.

Rob Daviau is from the US and he designs special board games called ‘legacy’ games. He thought that the board games he played as a child were not fun or challenging anymore. So, he began to think about how board games could change. He asked himself if board games could have a story and if choices made in one game could affect the next game. 
He changed a classic board game called Risk to create a new version called Risk Legacy. In this game, choices made by players during the game have lasting effects. Players might have to tear up cards, change the board, or open new packets with different rules. The games are played over a set number of sessions, and players can hold grudges against each other. Daviau said, “You could point to the board and say: ‘Right here! You did this!’”
Later, he worked on a legacy version of Pandemic, a popular game where players work together to cure diseases. His next game was called SeaFall. Pandemic Legacy was very popular, but many people thought SeaFall was a big test for legacy games because it was the first game that did not come from an earlier version. In SeaFall, players are sailors in the age of sail (16th to mid-19th century) and they explore a new world.
Designers of legacy games must think about all the choices players can make to keep the story interesting. They use play-testers to see how the games work. Jaime Barriga was a play-tester for SeaFall. He said, “It takes a lot of time. The first few games are great, but then it can start to break. You have to go back and fix everything.”
At first, legacy games were not expected to be very popular. Daviau thought it would only be interesting to a few people. He said, “I thought I would be known as the guy who did this weird project.” But many players, like Russell Chapman, loved the idea. He thinks it is one of the best changes in game design in years. He said, “It’s a new level of commitment and excitement.”
Another fan, Ben Hogg, said that the fun of a new adventure was more important than worrying about how long the game would last. He mentioned that people don’t usually watch the same movie twice in the cinema. They want a new experience. Legacy games bring a story like video games do.
The legacy format is inspired by video games and popular TV shows. While in college, Daviau wanted to be a television writer, but he moved to advertising and then to game design. However, he still loves telling stories. Matt Leacock, the creator of Pandemic, said that making a legacy game is like writing a novel. “You need to know how you want it to end and where you want it to begin,” he said. 
Daviau feels proud of his work but is curious to see how others will use the idea. He thinks that soon gamers will want something new. Colby Dauch, the studio manager for SeaFall, believes that the legacy format has changed how people think about board games.

One night not long ago, an octopus named Inky climbed out of his tank at New Zealand’s National Aquarium. He moved across the floor and squeezed into a small drain that led to the Pacific Ocean. This story was exciting and was shared a lot online. People enjoy stories like this because they like to think that animals are like us. Octopuses are especially interesting because they are very smart and look very different from us. 
Octopuses can do many amazing things. They can open jars, recognize faces, use coconut shells for protection, and even play games. Some scientists think that saying animals are like humans is not scientific. Dr. Frans de Waal, who studies animals like gorillas and chimpanzees, believes that we often ignore the human-like traits of animals. He calls this "anthropodenial." 
Dr. de Waal has studied animal intelligence for many years. He says that animals can think about the past and future, show empathy, and understand what others want. This means animals are smarter than we usually think. 
In the past, people believed that animals were smart. In medieval Europe, animals could even be put on trial for crimes. In the 1800s, many scientists looked for similarities between human and animal intelligence. Charles Darwin, who changed how we see our place in the world, said that the difference between humans and animals is not so big. 
In the 20th century, people started to see animals differently. They thought animals only reacted to rewards and punishments. Many people who believed animals had feelings were seen as unrealistic. This change happened at the same time that humans were harming animal habitats and not caring for animals. 
Now, Dr. de Waal thinks we are starting to understand animal intelligence better. He says that we are learning that animal thinking is similar to human thinking, even if they are not the same. He believes that we have learned a lot about animals in recent years. 
Dr. de Waal says that the best tests for animal intelligence should consider what each animal can do. For example, squirrels may not do well on human memory tests, but they can remember where they hide their nuts. In her book, naturalist Sy Montgomery says that if an octopus tested human intelligence, it might judge us by how well we can change the colors of our skin. If we fail, it might think we are not very smart.
Dr. de Waal is not sure if Inky really found a way to escape to the ocean. He thinks it is too hopeful to believe that Inky knew how to get to the drain. But he understands that stories like Inky’s help people appreciate animal intelligence. 
He once did an experiment to see if capuchin monkeys can feel envy. When the monkeys got cucumbers (which they like) or grapes (which they like even more), the monkeys who got cucumbers got very upset when they saw others getting grapes. The study was published in a scientific journal, but a video of the experiment made people really believe the findings. This shows how our minds work in special ways. 
**Questions:**
1. What did Inky the octopus do one night?
2. Why do people enjoy stories about animals like Inky?
3. What are some things that octopuses can do?
4. What does Dr. Frans de Waal study?
5. What did Charles Darwin say about the difference between humans and animals?
6. How did views on animal intelligence change in the 20th century?
7. What does Dr. de Waal believe about animal intelligence today?
8. What example does Dr. de Waal give about squirrels and their memory?
9. What might an octopus think about human intelligence, according to Sy Montgomery?
10. What did Dr. de Waal find out about capuchin monkeys and envy?

Robots were once only in stories about the future, but now they are changing our world. Robots have been used in car factories and other industries for many years. Experts say that soon, robots will be used in many more areas, and many people are not ready for this big change. 
Many people think that robots will do most of the work that humans do in the next 50 years. However, about 80% of people believe their jobs will still exist in the same way. This is not true: robots will affect every job in the next few years. For example, an Australian company called Fastbrick Robotics has made a robot named Hadrian X. This robot can lay 1,000 bricks in one hour, while two human workers would take a whole day to do the same job. 
Another example is a robot called Tally, made by a company in San Francisco. Tally walks around supermarkets to check if the shelves are full and the prices are correct. It does not clean the aisles, as some might think. 
Supporters of robots say that robots cannot fix or program themselves yet. This means there will be new jobs for skilled workers like technicians and programmers. However, some people worry that we need to keep the human touch in jobs. They believe society is not ready for the changes that robots will bring. 
Dr. Jing Bing Zhang is an expert on robots and their use in business. He studies how robots will change jobs in the future. His recent report says that in two years, many robots will be smarter and able to work with other robots and humans. In three years, many big companies will have a chief robotics officer, and some governments will create laws about robots. In five years, salaries in the robotics field will go up by at least 60%, but many jobs will still be empty because there are not enough skilled workers.
Zhang says that robots will affect lower-skilled workers, which is sad. He believes that these workers should not wait for the government to protect their jobs. Instead, they should find ways to learn new skills. People cannot expect to do the same job for their whole lives anymore.
New technologies will create new types of robots for homes. These robots will be able to talk and interact with us in new ways, like the robots we see in science fiction. Zhang believes this is a great chance for companies, but it also brings challenges, like the need for new rules to keep us safe.
With many jobs at risk, it is important to focus on education to prepare for the future with robots. Developed countries need more graduates in science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) to stay competitive. 
**Questions:**
1. What are robots changing in our world?
2. What can the Hadrian X robot do?
3. What does the Tally robot check in supermarkets?
4. What does Dr. Jing Bing Zhang study?
5. Why do some people worry about robots taking jobs?
6. What should lower-skilled workers do according to Zhang?
7. What new types of robots will be created for homes?
8. Why is education important for the future with robots?

George Mallory, a famous mountaineer, once answered a reporter's question about why he wanted to climb Mount Everest by saying, "Because it’s there." This answer shows a common feeling: many people wonder why someone would want to do something so dangerous and difficult. Some people might feel inspired by his answer to follow their own dreams. Climbing can be about adventure and fun.
In 1967, a Bolivian writer named Tejada-Flores wrote an important essay called "Games that Climbers Play." He talked about seven different climbing activities, or "games," from playing on small rocks to climbing high mountains. Each game has its own rules, and the way climbers choose to climb depends on these rules. Over the years, this idea has become popular in climbing discussions in the West, appearing in climbing magazines and conversations.
Many climbers love climbing because it makes them feel free. However, climbing can also be very limiting. For example, being stuck in a tent during a storm is not what most people think of as freedom. This creates a contradiction in climbing. But some people believe that having fewer choices can make life simpler and give a different kind of freedom.
When asked, "Why climb?" US rock climber Joe Fitschen suggests asking, "Why do people climb?" He believes climbing is part of who we are as humans. We like to take on challenges and test our limits, even if it is risky. The joy we find in climbing is more about our nature than just thinking about it logically.
Another important idea comes from US academic Brian Treanor. He says that climbing can help us develop important qualities like courage, humility, and respect for nature. While not all climbers show these qualities, Treanor believes they are especially important in today's world, which often avoids risks. Climbing can help us grow and live better lives outside of climbing.
Some expert climbers, Ebert and Robinson, believe that climbing alone, without help from others or technology, is more challenging and deserves more recognition. They think that climbing independently is harder and riskier, but this idea has caused some controversy. It may encourage some climbers to take unnecessary risks.
We can also look at climbing from a different perspective. Many climbers talk about being in the moment or going with the flow. The physical effort of climbing, the focus needed, and the problem-solving involved are all key parts of the experience. Some people say that climbing is similar to Zen philosophy, which teaches how to calm the mind and find peace. This idea can help us understand why people are attracted to climbing.

For over sixty years, the pianist Alfred Brendel was very important in classical music. He was a serious person who played and recorded many famous European piano pieces. He wrote a lot of music but taught very few students. People who knew him saw a fun side to him, but he did not show this in his concerts. He spent his time studying, traveling, and performing.
About four or five years ago, a young boy named Kit Armstrong came to one of Brendel’s concerts and asked for lessons. At first, Brendel did not take this seriously. He had very few students and did not want to start teaching now. He remembered a famous pianist saying, “You don’t ask a mountain guide to teach a child how to walk.” But when he heard Kit play, he was impressed. Kit was about 14 years old and played very well from memory. He even gave Brendel a CD of his performance, which was beautiful. Brendel thought, “I have to make time for him.” 
As Brendel stops performing in public, Kit is starting to become known. Brendel is careful because he worries that Kit might burn out too quickly. Now 19, Kit is always busy. He learns new languages, studies math, writes computer code, and plays tennis, all while his mother watches over him. He also composes music. Brendel says this is important because writing music helps you learn to read it better. He noticed that Kit has an amazing memory and can read music very well. Kit listens to his own playing and understands Brendel’s lessons. When Brendel tells him something to do in a piece of music, Kit can do it everywhere in that piece.
Brendel is careful not to raise expectations for Kit. He gets upset when newspapers call Kit the great pianist of the 21st century. He thinks this is not good and can cause problems. Like many talented young musicians, Kit can play some things very well, but he still needs time to improve on others. It would be unfair if a critic expected him to be perfect.
Now at 80 years old, Brendel is more relaxed in his life after performing. He says, “When I was young, I did not want to be famous quickly, but I wanted to achieve certain things by the age of 50. When I turned 50, I felt I had done most of those things, but I still wanted to do more, so I continued. Even though I cannot play like I used to, I still have many ideas in my head and pieces I have never played. I don’t perform now, but I enjoy this new part of my life.”

"When I was little, I thought gardens were beautiful places. My grandad’s garden was by a river. It sloped down to the water. You couldn’t touch the river, but you could hear the water and the birds in the trees. I thought all gardens were like this – a peaceful escape. Grandad’s garden was simple. He didn’t have a big greenhouse like some neighbors. Their greenhouses were made from old window frames with plastic covering broken glass. 
At home, my dad was quiet. He was not without humor. He liked to say funny phrases, like ‘It’s immaterial to me.’ He could have just said ‘I don’t mind,’ but he liked the word ‘immaterial.’ Deep down, he might have felt sad about his life. He left school without any qualifications and became a plumber. He didn’t love plumbing; it was just a job. He wasn’t very ambitious, but once he and my mum thought about moving to Canada, but it didn’t happen. 
My dad was good at fixing things around the house. He could build bookshelves or cupboards very well. My parents only moved house once. But my mum liked to change the furniture a lot. Just when you got used to one chair, another would appear. The biggest change was when a piano came into the house. I wanted to like it, but it scared me. I liked the two brass candlesticks on it, but my mum said they were too fancy, and they disappeared while I was at school. I was never allowed to play the piano; my sister had lessons instead. When I asked my mum why I couldn’t play, she said, ‘You’d never have practiced.’
Of the three places to go – moors, woods, or river – I liked the river best. I could imagine another world there. With a fishing net, I would walk along the riverbank in my old sandals, looking for a good spot to take them off. I would leave my sandals with my picnic and look for fish in the water to catch. After trying to keep them alive in the yard, I had to put them back in the river.
I wanted to leave school quickly, but it seemed hard until one day my dad said, ‘There’s a job for an apprentice gardener in the Parks Department. I thought you might like it.’ In that moment, my dad surprised me. He might have preferred if I became a carpenter, but I think he hoped that I would do well as a gardener. Even though he didn’t like gardening, he saw how much I enjoyed it."

'Lawrence MacEwen is on his Scottish island, the Isle of Muck. I am with him. A strong wind is blowing, and it feels like we could be blown off the cliff and into the ocean below. MacEwen’s sheepdog, Tie, comes close, and MacEwen gently pets him. The wind is loud, but MacEwen is calm and happy on his island. He shows me around and points to the north. “That island is Eigg. The one next to it is the Isle of Rum. It gets a lot more rain than we do.” I see dark clouds over Rum’s big mountains. “Beyond Rum is the island of Soay.” 
Suddenly, MacEwen says, “I have sheep to move.” We walk down the hill. He tells me about the island: Muck is three kilometers long and one and a half kilometers wide; the geese eat a lot of grass; and the MacEwen family has lived here for 3000 years. While moving the sheep, Tie is not doing a good job. “Away to me, Tie. Away to me,” MacEwen says, meaning the dog should go to the right. But Tie goes straight through the sheep, causing confusion. MacEwen sounds disappointed. “That will never do.” Tie looks sorry.
The Isle of Muck is mostly run by the MacEwen family. Lawrence and his wife, Jenny, run the farm. Their son Colin takes care of the island cottages, and their daughter Mary runs the island hotel, Port Mor, with her husband, Toby. Mary and Toby enjoy that their two boys can explore the island and sail small boats in summer. “They go out and come back when they are hungry.” But life on the island has some challenges. For example, electricity is not always available. On my first evening, I wait for the lights to turn on. The next morning, I see Mary making breakfast with a flashlight. I also have no mobile phone service. “You can get a signal on the hill,” Mary says. “Most people last a couple of days without their phone.” So I do the same.
Everything on Muck feels special. A boat brings groceries and three musicians who come to play music. Their concert in the tearoom is very popular, and the islanders enjoy the music. That night, by the warm fire, Lawrence tells me how he met Jenny. “Her father bought a small farm on the isle of Soay from a newspaper ad without seeing it. He had never been to Scotland. Jenny went to manage it.” Did Jenny know how to run a farm? “She was good at typing.”
I go to bed with the sound of rain and wake up to more rain. But I eat well, as most of the food comes from the island. Mary sends me to fisherman Sandy Mathers for fresh fish. I bring it back to Mary at the kitchen door. By 7 pm, our fish is on the table, and it is very tasty. The next morning, I have to take a ferry to another island. Many ferries had been cancelled in the last two months because of rough seas. If my ferry does not come, I will be stuck on Muck for two more days. And secretly, I wish for that.'

The game design industry used to be mostly for computer scientists and self-taught people. Many thought video games were just a hobby for young people, but now the industry is taken seriously. It is not easy to get into this field. Making video games based on new movies needs many team members and a lot of skill and hard work. 
Jim Donelly, a spokesperson for an online games magazine, says, “It is hard to get a job in big companies or to change big games. But the industry needs game designers more than ever. They need not just the top people who manage the whole game, but also the people who design parts of the game.”
So, how can you start a career in this competitive industry? Many companies want people with a degree in computer science, but Jim thinks differently. He says, “The only way is to make games. The tools are available. You won’t get a job if you haven’t made anything. Game design is not just a job; it is a way of life. You must create to be real.”
Another expert, John Field, agrees but adds that it is more complicated. “Many people want to work in games, but few meet the industry’s needs. Even fewer have the creativity, skills, and vision to help the industry grow.” 
Can you work alone? “Maybe, but it is hard,” says John. “A good course in games can help you and give you support. Most game designers start as programmers or artists and then move up. They are interested in all kinds of entertainment and culture. They may have worked for a few years after school but know that games are their passion. They are not just fans; they are excited about the future of games and see many new possibilities.”
Connections can also help you get ahead in the game industry. This is often forgotten, but networking is important in many fields. 
The idea of a young boy playing video games all the time is changing. Now, many adults and families play games together. Smartphones have many new games through apps and social media. John believes there is a lot of room for growth. “Games are now enjoyed by many people. They are also a great way to learn, and I see many new opportunities in this area.” 
**Questions:**
1. Who used to work in the game design industry?
2. What does Jim Donelly say about getting a job in big companies?
3. What does Jim think is the only way to get into game design?
4. What do most game designers start as?
5. Why is networking important in the game industry?

"Since I was a child, I have always wanted to play football. My dad encouraged me to play, and I am thankful for that. I had a friend who came to the park with us, but his dad was very strict. He always said, ‘You can’t do this, you can’t do that.’ My friend could have been a good player, but he stopped wanting to play and has not played football since. I am happy that I still love football. 
When I score a great goal from far away, some people say it is just luck, but it is not. I have practiced taking shots at goal from a distance since I was a kid. You need to practice to score amazing goals. The best players in the world have natural talent, but they also practice a lot. Sometimes young players bump into each other, but I learned the right way to play. When I teach kids, I always tell them to enjoy learning new skills.
At school, I played many sports like rounders, baseball, athletics, and basketball. I know now that a good education is important, but football was my main focus then. The teachers did a good job, but I did not notice it at the time. I want my son to have a different experience. We are already trying to read him books, even though he is too young to sit still for long. I hope he does not just want to kick the books around like I did.
At the start of my professional football career, the manager made sacrifices so that young players like us could play for the first team. He did not make a big deal about it, but we all knew we had to prove ourselves. I scored in the first game of the season, but we lost. A famous TV presenter said, ‘You can’t win anything with kids.’ This made us realize we had a lot to do. We had some doubts, but we believed in ourselves as a team.
I depend on my close friends and family. Having money can sometimes cause problems. People ask me why I let my mother keep working. I help my parents with money. I paid off their house loan and bought them a car last Christmas. My family is strong, and they do not want to be treated like they need my money. My mum loves her job as a hairdresser, even if she does not earn much. I enjoy using my money to help the people around me.
I have a lot of money, but that does not solve all my problems. After I stop playing football, I want to take a year off to do things I have not done for a long time. I want to go skiing the day after I stop playing. I cannot do that now because if I break a leg while skiing and cannot play football again, I would not be insured."

Sam Carter helped us move to Reef Point. He was my father’s agent in Los Angeles. My father could not write anything while we lived there, so Sam offered to find us a cheap place to live. The beach at Reef Point was usually quiet because many people preferred to go to a nearby resort called La Carmella. But now, with the hot weather, many people came to the beach. 
My father was busy every day trying to write a script. I often went to the beach with my dog, Rusty. When we first moved to Reef Point, we did not have a dog, but Rusty started to follow me. I tried to send him away, but he always came back. One morning, I felt sorry for him and gave him some water. My father did not really want him around, but Rusty kept getting closer. I asked my father, “Who does he belong to?” My father said, “He thinks we belong to him.”
Rusty loved the beach. He liked to dig and bring things to me. Sometimes he found things that did not belong to him, like a sneaker or a beach towel, and I had to give them back. Rusty also liked to swim with me, even though I could swim faster than him. 
One day, after swimming, my father went to Los Angeles to deliver his script. Rusty and I stayed at the beach and watched the surfers. They had been surfing all day and looked like they were having fun. One surfer was very good and caught my attention. She rode a wave and then came to talk to me. 
“Hi! Why didn’t you join us?” she asked. 
“I don’t have a surfboard,” I replied. 
“You could get one,” she said. 
“I don’t have any money.” 
“Are you British? Are you visiting?” 
“No, I live here.” 
“Is your father American?” 
“No, he came here to write a film script from a novel he wrote.” 
“Really? What’s his name?” 
“Rufus Marsh.” 
“Do you mean ‘Tall as the Morning’?” 
I nodded. 
“I read that book!” she said, looking at me with interest. I felt happy because people were friendly when I talked about my father’s book.

"What have I done?" Violet Hetherington asked herself. She was standing in a long line at the dock in Southampton. The line was outside the building marked ‘Departures’, waiting to board the Queen Caroline. No one was moving. Her friend Annie had told her, "It’s best to get to the docks late. If you arrive too early, you will just wait." Annie was married to a diplomat and traveled a lot. But this time, her advice was not good. 
After a while, an announcement came over the loudspeakers: there was a problem with the computer system. The mood of the waiting passengers became worse. Some tried to be patient, and a few even tried to be cheerful, but most people were unhappy. They had paid a lot of money for this trip. This might be their last chance for a nice vacation. The fact that they could not board the ship quickly made them feel worse. Violet wanted to leave. 
She checked her bag for her phone and realized it was missing. This was more annoying than the long wait. It made her feel that going on a cruise was a mistake. Now she had the problem of the missing phone. She could not call the taxi company to see if she left it in the taxi because the number was in her phone. Her older son Harry always told her to avoid this mistake. 
Behind her in the line, there was a friendly couple. "I’m sorry, but I think I left my mobile phone behind. Can I borrow yours to make a call?" Violet asked. She called Harry on their phone and left a message for him to ask her neighbor, Kristina, to check if the phone was at her flat. If it was not there, she would be in trouble because she had no other way to find the numbers she needed in New York. Part of her thought, "Thank goodness," but she did not tell Harry this. Harry thought he was more experienced than his mother. Daniel, her younger son, was more understanding of her mistakes, but that was because he made the same ones. Dan might forget to give the message to Kristina.
Finally, the line started to move, and Violet went to a window where she gave her travel documents and got ready to board. Her heart sank when she entered the ship’s lobby. It looked like a fancy hotel that was not very good. There were shiny fake wood panels, big chandeliers, shiny brass, and carpets like those in airports. Violet followed the signs to the ‘Elevators’, which were full of mirrors and crowded with tired passengers. They might have preferred not to see their reflections. 
Violet was pressed against the side of the lift as it went up, stopping at each floor to let people out. At last, on the twelfth floor, she stepped out and felt free. And, thankfully, her room had the balcony she had asked for. She had been worried about what to say if it did not. Ignoring Annie’s advice to wait for a better deal, she had decided to pay the highest price she could afford to make sure she had a nice view of the sea.

John Maloof bought a box of old photo negatives at an auction. He wanted pictures for a book about Portage Park, a neighborhood in Chicago, USA. Instead, he found 30,000 photos by Vivian Maier, a street photographer. Since then, Maloof has collected many things about her life and work. In his home, he has her cameras, 2,000 rolls of film, 3,000 prints, and 100,000 negatives, along with some 8mm movies and audiotapes.
One morning, Maloof looked around at all the items. He felt he was close to something special, and it happened by chance. He said, “When I bought all this, I had no idea what it was. I could have just sold it all to someone else.” Maloof and his friend Anthony Rydzon have been learning about Maier’s life. They talked to families who hired her as a nanny and to people who developed her film.
Vivian Maier was born in 1926 in New York and spent much of her childhood in France. In 1951, she returned to New York and moved to Chicago in 1956 to work as a nanny. Maier was a private person and always had a camera with her. She wore big coats, wide-brimmed hats, and sturdy shoes. Maren Baylaender, whose husband hired Maier, said, “On her day off, she always had her camera. We wouldn’t see her until late at night.” Maier had strong opinions about movies and politics and knew a lot about theater and films. 
Even though she was not very social, she walked the streets with her camera and talked to people. She loved documenting the world around her. Rydzon said, “She was a true artist and followed her dreams.” Maier’s work was not for money; it was pure art. She took pictures of women, children, the elderly, the poor, and abstract scenes. Photography expert Larry Silverman said, “Vivian has many interesting pictures.” He wonders if she created her own style or learned from other photographers.
Maloof often thinks about whether he will ever go through all the negatives he has stored in three fireproof cabinets. He did not care much about photography until he found Maier’s work. Inspired by her photos, he started taking his own pictures. He said, “I realized that the people and street scenes were more important than I thought. I was sitting on something more important than I ever imagined. Now our goal is to make Vivian Maier known and get her into the history books.”

When a novel is called ambitious, it often means it did not succeed completely. But this is not true for Eleanor Catton’s book, The Luminaries. I spoke with her in the UK when her book was very popular. She was calm, even though she was still in her twenties. She had just come from Germany and was going back to New Zealand the next day. She told me a story about being stopped at passport control. The officer asked her to prove she was a writer. She showed her novel to him. The officer looked at it and asked, “What is it about?” This is not an easy question for a writer. 
The Luminaries takes place in New Zealand during the 1860s. There are many crimes, and a group of 12 men is trying to solve them. The story becomes very complicated. Catton wanted to write a murder mystery, not a historical novel, but she found that the past gave her many chances to create problems for her characters. The book is more than 800 pages long because she wanted to give each of the 20 main characters a good story. 
When I asked her how it feels to be so successful at a young age, she said, “It’s nice coming from a small country because everyone feels like the success is partly theirs. People at home are very supportive.” She also said, “What annoys me is when people think my book is not serious.” 
Catton wanted to write the book in a spiral shape. Each part is half the length of the part before it, so the story speeds up as it goes. I asked her if it matters if readers notice this. She said, “I wanted to create patterns in the book that don’t matter, but if you care, you can find them.” 
Even with its unique structure, The Luminaries is still an exciting murder mystery. Surprisingly, Catton did not know how the story would end before she wrote it. She said, “I would write myself into a corner and then see how I could get out of it.” She wanted to make the book fun for readers. 
We also talked about her love for TV dramas. I asked if she would like to write for television. She said, “That could be pretty cool.” She was very excited when talking about her work and New Zealand. She said, “When I come to Britain, my imagination changes because I am in a different place. I understand why writers leave New Zealand for busy cities to be around more people.” But for now, New Zealand will still be her home. I hope it gives her inspiration for many more novels.

When Jonny Kinkead was a boy, he liked to make things in his dad’s garage and play the guitar. For the last forty years, he has built acoustic guitars by hand. Jonny loves the guitar. He wonders how two pieces of wood can make a beautiful sound. He learned to play his brother’s guitar when he was eleven. At sixteen, he wanted to learn the bass guitar. Instead of saving money for one, he decided to make it himself. He studied how different shapes and types of wood change the sound of the guitar.
Jonny built his first bass guitar, but he did not think about making guitars as a job at that time. He also liked painting and sculpture. After school, he studied architecture at university because he liked design. But halfway through, he left because he wanted to do something different. He realized that making guitars is like making sculpture, but with sound. He thought it was a good idea because people use the guitars he makes.
Since then, Jonny has made guitars for a living. For the first ten years, he also cleaned windows to earn extra money. At first, he sold his guitars for the cost of materials, but later he became known as a good guitar maker and could charge more. Even now, after almost forty years, he says he is still just getting by. He can only make about ten guitars a year, which limits his income.
In the beginning, Jonny worked hard to get known. He went to music festivals and let musicians try his guitars. He also had to learn how to price his guitars because he didn’t think about money much. Jonny believes it is easier for new guitar makers today in the UK. When he started, many people thought only American-made guitars were good. But now, UK-made guitars are respected.
Jonny thinks new guitar makers should take courses to learn valuable skills. However, he also believes that learning by trying and making mistakes is important. He says it is good to look at other instruments and see what works and what doesn’t. If you make the back of a guitar too thin or too thick, it will not sound good. If you learn from someone else, you may only learn one way, but if you teach yourself, you can learn many things.

When people talk about English conversation, they often start with the weather. A famous writer from the 1700s, Dr. Johnson, said, “When two Englishmen meet, their first talk is of the weather.” This is still true today. Many people try to explain why the English talk about the weather so much, but they often get it wrong. They think that English people talk about the weather because they are very interested in it. 
The American writer Bill Bryson says that the English weather is not interesting. He points out that in other places, there are exciting weather events like tornadoes and big storms, but these are rare in England. The English broadcaster Jeremy Paxman disagrees with Bryson. He believes that English weather is interesting because it is always changing. He says that even if there are no big storms, the weather is still important because it is never completely predictable.
I think both Bryson and Paxman miss the main point. When English people talk about the weather, they are not really talking about the weather. They use weather talk as a way to connect with each other. For example, when someone says, “Nice day, isn’t it?” or “Ooh, isn’t it cold?” they are not really asking about the weather. These phrases are just ways to start a conversation or fill a pause.
There are specific times when people use weather talk. Some people say that the English talk about the weather all the time, but that is not true. Weather talk is used mainly in three situations: as a greeting, to start a conversation, or when there is a pause in the conversation. Because of this, it may seem like English people talk about the weather a lot. An English conversation might start with a weather greeting, then move to other topics, and return to the weather when there is a silence. This is why many people think that English people are obsessed with the weather.

Alice Leader was standing in front of Hadrian’s Wall in Britain. She was trying to explain to her class of 12- and 13-year-olds how amazing it was that the Romans built something 120 km long and 5 meters high about 1900 years ago. The students were interested in this trip instead of going to Spain, Greece, or France. But they wanted to know why the wall was built. Alice felt her answers were not good enough. 
She could not find a good historical novel about life at the Wall in Roman times, so she decided to write one herself. After teaching for 31 years, Alice started a new career as a writer in 2001. She felt nervous but excited about this big change. Alice said, “Teaching is like acting. It is very demanding. Writing is exciting, but it is not so tiring. My old teaching friends are jealous because I still connect with children through my stories.”
Alice wants her books to fill a gap in children’s fiction. She thinks many books for teenagers today talk about sad experiences. “They are well written,” she said, “but they are often dark. My books are different.” Alice always tried to teach English and History together. She loved to see when a child goes from being bored to interested. “I enjoy having bored children because it is a challenge for me to make them interested,” she said.
Alice started writing her first novel because she saw a need for it. She was also inspired by her head teacher, who suggested she take a creative writing course. At first, Alice did not want to do it. She had been teaching for 25 years and thought the course was not necessary. But before the course, she had to send her best story to the teachers. She quickly wrote a story about a Roman couple and their baby. After three hours and 30 pages, she sent it in and was accepted.
During the course, other students read her story and gave her good feedback. They suggested she publish it. With only 8,000 report cards to show her writing skills, she asked her head teacher for a year off to write her first novel. Alice’s husband, Zachary Leader, is a critic and editor. He helped her a lot with editing the novel. Alice said, “My mother-in-law thinks we are rival authors, but I think we help each other. He changes the sentences and suggests better words. I like to add more scenes. That is the difference between a fiction writer and an editor.” 
**Questions:**
1. What was Alice trying to explain to her class?
2. Why did Alice decide to write a novel?
3. How long did Alice teach before she became a writer?
4. What did Alice’s head teacher suggest she do?
5. Who helped Alice with editing her novel?

To raise money for charity, a newspaper and a TV company asked brothers Jonny and Alistair Brownlee, who are champion triathletes, to join a special race. This race would have Jonny in a car and Alistair on a mountain bike. They would race in the beautiful and hilly Yorkshire Dales in northern England. Jonny would drive on the roads, while Alistair would ride across the countryside.
“I’m excited!” Jonny said at the start line. “I’ve never done this before. The views are beautiful, and it’s cold, so I will be warm in the car.” Alistair was also excited, but he wore warm cycling clothes. “I’ve seen Jonny drive before,” he said. “I’m not sure he will make it. I might stop for tea on the way.”
